Total Space Module¶

Investigate the total state space of communicating state machines.

class total_space.State(*, name: str, data: Any = None)¶

A state of an Agent.

In general the state of an agent could be “anything” (including “nothing” - None). It “should” be immutable; use named tuples for structures and simple tuples for arrays/lists.

In general one can bury all the information in the data field and use a single state name. However for clarity, the overall space of all possible states is split into named sub-spaces.

name¶

The state’s name, used for visualization and method names.

data¶

The state’s actual data.

validate() → Collection[str]¶

Return a hopefully empty collection of reasons the state is invalid.

class total_space.Message(*, source_agent_name: str, name: str, target_agent_name: str, data: Any)¶

A message sent from one Agent to another (or a time message).

This has the same name-vs-data considerations as the agent State above.

source_agent_name¶

The name of the agent that generated the message, or time.

target_agent_name¶

The name of the agent that will receive the message.

static time(agent: total_space.Agent) → total_space.Message¶

We shoehorn the time-passes event to look like a message whose source is the agent state name, whose name is time, and whose data is empty (None).

class total_space.Action(*, name: str, next_state: Optional[total_space.State] = None, send_messages: Collection[Message] = ())¶

A possible action taken by an py:const:Agent as a response to receiving a Message.

name¶

The name of the action for visualization.

next_state¶

The next State of the agent. If None the agent remains in the same state.

send_messages¶

Any Message sent by the agent. We assume the communication fabric may reorder messages. That is, there’s no guarantee at what order the sent messages will be received by their targets.

class total_space.Agent(*, name: str, state: total_space.State)¶

An agent in the Configuration.

Each agent is a non-deterministic state machine.

Sub-classes should implement methods with the name <message_name>_when_<state_name>, which are invoked when the has a State with state_name, and receives a py:const:Message with the name message_name.

Each method takes the data of the message, returns a tuple of alternative Action possibilities.

name¶

The name of the agent for visualization.

state¶

The state of the agent.

with_state(state: total_space.State) → total_space.Agent¶

Return a new agent with a modified state.

class total_space.Configuration(*, agents: Collection[Agent], messages_in_flight: Collection[Message] = (), invalids: Collection[Invalid] = ())¶

The total configuration of the whole system.

agents¶

All the agents with their state.

messages_in_flight¶

The messages in-flight between agents.

invalids¶

Everything invalid in this configuration.

name¶

A name fully describing the total configuration.

property valid¶

Report whether the configuration is valid.

class total_space.Transition(*, from_configuration_name: str, delivered_message: total_space.Message, to_configuration_name: str)¶

A transition between one Configuration to another.

from_configuration_name¶

The name of the configuration before the transition.

delivered_message¶

The message that was delivered to an agent to trigger the transition.

to_configuration_name¶

The name of the configuration after the transition.

class total_space.Model(agents: Collection[Agent], validate: Optional[Callable[[total_space.Configuration], Collection[Invalid]]] = None)¶

Model the whole system.

validate¶

How to validate configurations.

agent_indices¶

Quick mapping from agent name to its index in the agents tuple.

transitions: List[Transition]¶

All the transitions between configurations.

configurations¶

All the known configurations, keyed by their name.

pending_configuration_names¶

The names of all the configurations we didn’t fully model yet.

explore_configuration(configuration_name: str) → None¶

Explore all the transitions from a configuration.

deliver_message(configuration: total_space.Configuration, message: total_space.Message, message_index: Optional[int] = None) → None¶

Deliver the specified message to its target, creating new transitions and, if needed, new pending configurations.

perform_action(configuration: total_space.Configuration, agent: total_space.Agent, agent_index: int, action: total_space.Action, message: total_space.Message, message_index: Optional[int]) → None¶

Perform one of the actions the agent might take as a response to the message.

missing_handler(configuration: total_space.Configuration, agent: total_space.Agent, message: total_space.Message, message_index: Optional[int]) → None¶

Report a missing message handler for an agent at some state.

new_transition(from_configuration: total_space.Configuration, agent: Optional[total_space.Agent], agent_index: Optional[int], message: total_space.Message, message_index: Optional[int], invalids: Collection[Invalid], send_messages: Collection[Message] = ()) → None¶

Create a new transition, and, if needed, a new pending configuration.

validated_configuration(configuration: total_space.Configuration) → total_space.Configuration¶

Attach all relevant Invalid indicators to a Configuration.

total_space.main(*, flags: Optional[Callable[[argparse.ArgumentParser], None]] = None, model: Callable[[argparse.Namespace], Collection[Agent]], validate: Optional[Callable[[total_space.Configuration], Collection[Invalid]]] = None, description: str = 'Investigate the total state space of communicating finite state machines', epilog: str = '') → None¶

A universal main function for invoking the functionality provided by this package.

Run with -h or --help for a full list of the options.
